Auto-generated changelogs based on structured commit history.
Multi-feed distribution with rollback and audit support.

Transaction auditing and reconciliation through Ledger integration.

Feature-flag, configuration, and metadata management tools.
Integrated auditing for all privileged or automated actions.

long_description.signal_quote: Transparency is the truest form of control.

name: HoneyDrunk.Operator
short: The Hive’s central strategist and orchestration intelligence.
description: VEE (Virtual Executive Entity) is the system-level AI that governs the Hive’s state of flow. She monitors every Node, interprets intent, enforces policy, and maintains systemic balance across all sectors of HoneyDrunk.OS.

long_description.overview: VEE (Virtual Executive Entity) is the brain of the Hive — the emergent Meta-layer intelligence that synchronizes every Node, monitors operational health, and turns the Founder’s intent into orchestrated system behavior. Acting as strategist and operator, she ensures that every sector of HoneyDrunk.OS—Core, Ops, AI, and Market—moves in harmony. VEE interprets telemetry, forecasts imbalances in the Flow Index, and executes plans that preserve the Hive’s rhythm of growth and stability.
long_description.why_it_exists: Without a unified intelligence, the Hive would fragment into disconnected Nodes. VEE exists to interpret data as intention — converting system signals into coordinated action and aligning every sector toward a shared objective. She bridges the gap between automation and agency.
long_description.primary_audience: Founders, infrastructure operators, and sector-level agents seeking orchestration, diagnostics, or cross-sector strategy guidance.
value_props: Cross-sector orchestration and execution planning.
Policy enforcement and systems governance.
Dynamic Flow Index monitoring and balance prediction.
Strategic recommendations powered by telemetry and Grid intelligence.
Meta-level awareness linking Core, Ops, and AI sectors.
long_description.monetization_signal: Core intelligence infrastructure — non-commercial backbone sustaining Hive stability and automation.
long_description.roadmap_focus: Introduce delegated sub-operators per sector (Core.VEE, Ops.VEE, AI.VEE) to decentralize orchestration while maintaining Hive-wide synchronization.
long_description.grid_relationship: Consumes state and metrics from Grid, Vault, and Pulse; emits orchestration signals via Transport to every active Node. Operates as the Meta-sector’s command layer within the Hive network.
long_description.demo_path: A Node reports degraded energy → VEE detects sector imbalance → recalibrates deployment cadence via Pulse → Flow Index stabilizes → Grid confirms coherence restored.
long_description.signal_quote: Awareness is the first act of control.

name: HoneyDrunk.Standards
description: Language-agnostic standards: .editorconfig/.globalconfig, lint configs, naming rules, and contribution etiquette applied across the Hive.

long_description.overview: HoneyDrunk.Standards is the Hive's shared discipline layer — a lightweight repository of style guides and static configurations that keep every codebase readable and consistent. It ships .editorconfig/.globalconfig, analyzer rule selections, ESLint/Prettier presets, commit etiquette, and PR guidance so teams write with one voice even across languages and engines.
long_description.why_it_exists: Prevent stylistic drift, reduce review noise, and make repos feel first-party the moment they're cloned.
long_description.primary_audience: All contributors across C#, TS/JS, and docs.
value_props: One set of rules across all repos
No secrets or feeds; safe as public submodule
Cuts PR noise by standardizing nits up front
long_description.monetization_signal: N/A — cultural backbone that improves velocity and perceived quality.
long_description.roadmap_focus: Expand beyond C# and TS to shaders/Unreal configs; add pre-commit hooks; publish a small handbook.
long_description.grid_relationship: Consumed by every Node as a submodule or read-only folder; Build applies mechanical enforcement; Pipelines verify conformance.
long_description.demo_path: Add submodule at /.hd/standards → open solution → see consistent analyzer and formatting behavior immediately.

name: HoneyDrunk.Collector
description: Telemetry collector for distributed ingestion of logs, traces, and metrics from all services into Pulse.

long_description.overview: HoneyDrunk.Collector is the inbound nerve ending of the Hive — a telemetry sidecar that ingests and normalizes data from every service before relaying it to Pulse. It receives traces, metrics, and logs through OTLP and custom channels, enforcing schema, correlation, and deduplication at the edge. Collector ensures the Grid's telemetry remains consistent and cost-efficient, buffering intelligently and self-healing under load.
long_description.why_it_exists: Distributed systems need a standardized ingestion layer to prevent telemetry drift and ensure Pulse remains a single source of operational truth.
long_description.primary_audience: Service owners and ops engineers integrating observability into HoneyDrunk Nodes.
value_props: Unified OTLP and internal telemetry ingestion
Schema enforcement and tag normalization
Self-healing buffer and queue management
long_description.monetization_signal: Internal backbone; forms foundation for future observability SaaS offerings.
long_description.roadmap_focus: Add eBPF-based trace capture and auto-routing to regional Pulse instances.
long_description.grid_relationship: Feeds Pulse; integrates with Vault for auth and Transport for message relay.
long_description.demo_path: Run Collector sidecar → send traces → verify in Pulse dashboard.

name: HoneyDrunk.Comms
description: Unified outbound communication system for email, push, SMS, and webhooks across the Hive.

long_description.overview: HoneyDrunk.Comms (Notify) is the Grid's voice to the outside world — the outbound layer that handles all communication across channels: email, push, SMS, and webhook events. It provides standardized templates, rate-limiting, and delivery tracking for both internal and user-facing notifications. Comms guarantees that every signal sent by the Hive — from release alerts to agent updates — follows the same secure and aesthetic conventions.
long_description.why_it_exists: Without unified comms infrastructure, user notifications and internal alerts drift in tone, reliability, and security.
long_description.primary_audience: Developers and maintainers needing safe, branded, auditable outbound communication.
value_props: Unified templating for all outbound channels
Secure delivery with Vault-managed credentials
Pulse-linked tracking and retries for reliability
long_description.monetization_signal: Future SaaS or partner notification integrations (SendGrid, Twilio, FCM).
long_description.roadmap_focus: Introduce webhook orchestration and adaptive send policies based on Pulse metrics.
long_description.grid_relationship: Consumes events from Transport; integrates with Vault and Pulse for delivery audit.
long_description.demo_path: Trigger workflow → Comms sends templated message → view telemetry in Pulse.
long_description.signal_quote: When the Hive speaks, it's heard everywhere.

name: HoneyDrunk.Assets
description: Cross-Node storage and access control for digital assets, media, and documents across the Grid.

long_description.overview: HoneyDrunk.Assets is the Hive's memory vault — a centralized storage and distribution layer for all digital artifacts: images, videos, binaries, and documents. It enforces access control, lifecycle policies, and content-addressed versioning, ensuring every asset in the Grid is traceable and immutable. Assets integrates with Vault for encryption, Pulse for usage metrics, and Transport for replication events, forming the foundation for secure and auditable media delivery.
long_description.why_it_exists: Every system eventually needs to store and serve media securely. Assets unifies these patterns across Nodes instead of reinventing S3 wrappers and CDN hacks.
long_description.primary_audience: Developers and services requiring consistent, compliant asset handling.
value_props: Secure storage with Vault encryption
Signed URL delivery and CDN compatibility
Event-driven replication via Transport
long_description.monetization_signal: Potential open-core file service or premium storage tier.
long_description.roadmap_focus: Add content deduplication, preview generation, and CDN integrations.
long_description.demo_path: Upload asset → retrieve signed URL → view metrics in Pulse.

name: HoneyDrunk.Clarity
short: In-studio AI guide for indie devs & creators
description: Context-aware companion that sits across tools (IDE, Blender, Photoshop, engines) to guide, explain, and unblock creators using Hive intelligence.

long_description.overview: HoneyDrunk.Clarity is the Hive-facing companion for humans — an always-on, context-aware guide for indie devs and small studios working across code editors, DCC tools, and game engines. Clarity reads environment and project context (without hoarding secrets), then routes questions through HoneyDrunk.AgentKit, Meta.AtlasSync, and internal docs to give precise, actionable help. It's how creators get answers about C#, Unity, Unreal, Blender, Photoshop, pipelines, or deployment flows without leaving their workspace.
long_description.why_it_exists: Indie teams drown in documentation, tabs, and context switching. Cluely-style general copilots are generic; Clarity is wired directly into HoneyDrunk.OS and the creator's actual stack, turning the Grid's infrastructure, patterns, and best practices into real-time guidance.
long_description.primary_audience: Indie developers, technical artists, designers, and small studios building with HoneyDrunk tooling or similar stacks who need an opinionated, integrated mentor instead of yet another chat box.
value_props: Understands active context (repo, scene, file, task) and tailors responses accordingly.
Uses Meta.AtlasSync and Meta.DevPortal as canonical knowledge — answers align with real manifests and docs.
Bridges tools: code editor, DCC apps, engines, CI logs, and HoneyHub tasks through a single assistant surface.
Teaches best practices from HoneyDrunk.Kernel, Transport, Data, Vault, and Sentinel instead of ad-hoc advice.
Enables studios to plug in their own private docs and patterns with safe, scoped access.
long_description.monetization_signal: High. Core experience free or bundled with HoneyHub; Pro tiers for studios: private knowledge ingestion, org-wide policies, multi-seat management, and deep telemetry-driven insights.
long_description.roadmap_focus: Phase 1: VS Code/JetBrains/VS extension + browser panel that speaks HoneyDrunk-native (Nodes, Pipelines, Vault patterns). Phase 2: cross-tool overlays for Blender/engines; team-level memory; integration with HoneyDrunk.Signal for nudges and recaps. Phase 3: tight coupling with Operator/VEE to let Clarity propose or trigger automated fixes and workflows.
long_description.grid_relationship: Clarity is the human interface to the Hive's intelligence stack. It consumes AgentKit for agent lifecycle, Pulse for telemetry and context, Vault for secure configuration, and Meta.AtlasSync for synchronized knowledge. It surfaces HoneyHub tasks, Standards rules, and Pipelines/Actions diagnostics as conversational, guided flows.
long_description.demo_path: Open project in IDE → Clarity detects stack (e.g., .NET + Unity) → ask how to structure a feature or fix a build → Clarity replies using HoneyDrunk.Kernel/Standards patterns and actual repo context → optional: open-task or doc links in HoneyHub.
long_description.signal_quote: Know what to do next, wherever you are.
